A few holidays words from Charlie Shrem, co founder of BitInstant
http://www.reddit.com/r/Bitcoin/comments/15ff2s/a_few_holidays_words_from_charlie_shrem_co/ … #Bitcoin
Great quote by @jonmatonis RT "Before the artificial crime of "money laundering" was created, the process went by another name: banking"
YES! @jonmatonis "Deflation is not problem in traditional monetary system...will not be a problem in bitcoin" economy."http://www.forbes.com/sites/jonmatonis/2012/12/23/fear-not-deflation/ …
@igorsyl http://bitcoinwireless.com/create  try it out!
http://BitcoinWireless.com  is in beta! Contact me for link details #Bitcoin
@csanati @ErikVoorhees Show me where you 'mention' it can be used legitimately? You wrote its "perfect for someone trying to skirt the law"
@csanati Poor assumption? You did not talk to any regulators, any companies within Bitcoin, any banks. What research did you do?
@csanati All I see is "Bitcoins are primarily accepted in the Internet underworld..you can buy and sell almost anything from drugs to guns"
@csanati You write: "Bitcoin seems to be gaining traction and legitimacy among those who need to transfer or launder their cash" Source?
@csanati Your key point is the assumption bitcoin is used 4 illicit trade and fail completely at proving that. @ErikVoorhees @sebicas
@csanati @sebicas "anything else?" YES respond to my other points, don't pick and chose like you did in the article.
@csanati @sebicas Where is the source? You should have said "90% of BTC are bought on legitimate exchanges" SOURCE: http://bitcoincharts.com/markets/
@csanati @sebicas LOL ".it could even eventually be used by the government of Iran to buy and sell weapons and oil." Is that a sick joke?
@csanati @sebicas Here is a list of 7 things wrong with the article http://pastie.org/5558723
@csanati @sebicas We spend more time and effort fighting money laundering to make BTC legitimate...your article was slap in my face
@csanati @sebicas I just wish you had gotten views from sources 'within' the Bitcoin community. You could have gotten the REAL story.
@csanati @sebicas Having another press source calling your editorial 'exaggerated' and how your "playing on fears and speculation "

@csanati @sebicas Even SiliconANGLE went out of their way to bash you. How embarrassing lolhttp://siliconangle.com/blog/2012/12/19/reports-of-bitcoins-criminal-potential-have-been-exaggerated-by-cnn-fortune/ …
@csanati @sebicas I see no *new* information, just copy and pasting from other sources. The whole editorial is a joke way to spin a story
@csanati @sebicas You did not talk to any regulators, any companies within Bitcoin, any banks. What research did you do?
@csanati @sebicas We create choke points preventing anyone depositing/withdrawing USD to launder money, and we do a damn good job at it.
@csanati @sebicas For one, you did not mention the rigorous AML and KYC procedures that companies like mine follow and the exchanges.
@sebicas It's not @csanati fault. CNN has been producing lies since founding. They call it Crappy News Network for a reason! #Bitcoin

"Bitcoin’s Criminal Potential Have Been Exaggerated by CNN" says SiliconANGLE http://siliconangle.com/blog/2012/12/19/reports-of-bitcoins-criminal-potential-have-been-exaggerated-by-cnn-fortune/ … @ErikVoorhees @jonmatonis @rogerkver
